item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why wordfreq will not be updated (51 points | 8 comments)
2. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (924 points | 387 comments)
3. Haxe lang – build cross-platform application with fast cross-compiler (63 points | 14 comments)
4. React for R (54 points | 21 comments)
5. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (267 points | 111 comments)
6. Independent directors of 23andMe resign from board (460 points | 224 comments)
7. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (569 points | 155 comments)
8. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (476 points | 155 comments)
9. Show HN: sol – A de-minifier for shell programs (74 points | 4 comments)
10. How Raw sockets behave differently in macOS and Linux (37 points | 5 comments)
11. A bottle of water per email: the hidden environmental costs of using AI chatbots (27 points | 25 comments)
12. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (269 points | 120 comments)
13. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (439 points | 47 comments)
14. Asgard launches world's first DDR5-9600 DIMMs (48 points | 24 comments)
15. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (9 points | discuss)
16. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (176 points | 24 comments)
17. John Peralta Explodes Historic Technology into Three-Dimensional Diagrams (70 points | 6 comments)
18. Reports of the death of dental cavities are greatly exaggerated (131 points | 77 comments)
19. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (247 points | 41 comments)
20. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (221 points | 72 comments)
21. Emerge Tools (YC W21) is hiring a senior front end engineer ( | hide)
22. NetWare NFS Gateway 1.1 (6 points | 2 comments)
23. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (904 points | 2045 comments)
24. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (271 points | 60 comments)
25. Scrolling Text Display (57 points | 3 comments)
26. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (190 points | 23 comments)
27. Rustpad is an efficient and minimal open-source collaborative text editor (65 points | 8 comments)
28. Implement algorithms that minimize slippage (44 points | 4 comments)
29. STORM: Get a Wikipedia-like report on your topic (119 points | 53 comments)
30. The port of the Windows 95 Start Menu was not all it seemed (45 points | 29 comments)
